com.safenetinc.luna.virtualhosts
Class AddVirtualHost

java.lang.Object
  com.safenetinc.luna.virtualhosts.AddVirtualHost
public class AddVirtualHost
extends java.lang.Object

LunaSP command line application used to setup a LunaSP for virtual hosting. This application does the following things to tomcat's server.xml:
- Removes the default connectors on ports 8080 and 8443
- Sets a predetermined 'secure' set of SSL ciphers
- Adds the host settings for the virtual host
- Creates the directories necessary for virtual hosting
See The Tomcat Documentation for more information

Author:
Paul Hampton

Method Detail

createVirtualHost

public void createVirtualHost(java.lang.String hostname,
                              int port,
                              java.lang.String keyAlias)
Creates a virtual host on a LunaSP. This method expects several things to be in place before it is run:

-The LunaSP command webs server port addSecure to have been run already in order to create a tomcat connector on the port the user wishes to access their new virtual host from.

-A SSL certificate to be in place within the HSM of the Luna. The Subject Key Identifier (SKI) of this certificate is passed to this method which will set this SKI as the SSL certificate for the port indicated by the port parameter.

Parameters:
hostname - The hostname of the virtual host to create for example viewpin.safenet-inc.com
port - The port to use for this virtual host
keyAlias - The Subject Key Identifier of the SSL certificate to be used on the port

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Main method for this application. Responsible for informing the user of the correct command-line arguments to use when invoking the application and in turn validating those parameters before calling the createVirtualHost(String, int, String) method.

Parameters:
args - Standard command line arguments
